meanings.definition: Lose or be deprived of as a penalty for wrongdoing or neglect.
meanings.sent1: He had to forfeit his allowance for not completing his chores.
meanings.sent2: She will forfeit the game if she doesn't follow the rules.
meanings.sent3: The cat had to forfeit its treat for knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The team had to forfeit their chance at victory due to a technicality.
meanings.sent5: The student had to forfeit his recess time for talking in class.

meanings.definition: Something surrendered or subject to surrender as punishment for a crime, an offense, an error, or a breach of contract.
meanings.sent1: The necklace was a forfeit for her dishonest actions.
meanings.sent2: The trophy served as a forfeit for the winning team.
meanings.sent3: The cake was a forfeit for losing the bet.
meanings.sent4: The keys were a forfeit for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent5: The ticket was a forfeit for entering the restricted area.
